fields.value: Estimates of the Population of Counties by Age, Sex, Race, and Hispanic Origin [United States]:  1990-1996

authorName.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

dsDescriptionValue.value:
These data are estimates of the resident population of the counties in the United States. Part 1 provides county population estimates by five-year age category (ages 0-4, 5-9, etc.), sex, and modified race/Hispanic origin. Data in Part 2 are presented by single-year age (under 1 year, 1 year, ..., 84 years, 85 years and over) and sex. Part 3 contains estimates of the state total and the counties of each state by modified race and Hispanic origin. The estimates are for July 1st of each year durin
g 1990-1996.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR I.A.4. Census Enumerations: Historical and Contemporary Population Characteristics, United States, Other Census, Including County and City Data Books

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: (1) The April 1, 1990, modified census counts for counties, (2) extracts of detailed individual-record data on births and deaths from the National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS), (3) annual extract of tax returns provided by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), (4) a 20-percent sample of information on the Social Security Administration Application File for internal migration, and (5) immigration data from the Immigration and Naturalization Service
All counties in the United States as identified in the 1990 Decennial Census.
